CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant appealed . It further found that ORG had based its decision on sufficient grounds . Lastly , as regards his argument concerning the absence of “ exceptional circumstances ” , ORG held as follows :
“ The exceptional nature of remanding a criminal suspect in custody implies that he must be charged not DATE from the time of his arrest . Otherwise , he should be immediately released . ”
